perturbation.original_text: 12.4 Insurance. Each party, at its own expense, shall maintain product liability and other appropriate insurance (or self- insure) in an amount consistent with industry standards during the Term and shall name the other party as an additional insured with respect to such insurance. Each party shall provide a certificate of insurance (or evidence of self-insurance) evidencing such coverage to the other party upon request.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.4 Insurance. Each party, at its own expense, may maintain product liability and other insurance (or self-insure) during the Term. Each party may provide a certificate of insurance (or evidence of self-insurance) evidencing such coverage to the other party upon request.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall maintain' to 'may maintain', the contract now allows a party to operate without insurance, which may violate California law regarding minimum liability coverage for businesses. Removing the requirement to name the other party as additional insured and weakening the proof of insurance clause also increase risk and contradict standard practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California law requires businesses to maintain certain levels of liability insurance to protect against potential damages or injuries to third parties.

perturbation.original_text: 5.2 Privacy. Biocept and Life Technologies and their respective Affiliates agree to protect the privacy and provide for the security of any information that relates to a patient's past, present, or future physical or mental health or condition in accordance with HIPAA, and any other applicable federal and state privacy laws and regulations in the Territory. Each party agrees to execute one or more Business Associate Agreements (as defined under HIPAA) as the other party, or its providers or payers, may from time to time request.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.2 Privacy. Biocept and Life Technologies and their respective Affiliates will make efforts to protect the privacy of patient health information. The execution of Business Associate Agreements will be determined on a case-by-case basis.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the commitment to HIPAA compliance. Replacing 'agree to protect... in accordance with HIPAA' with 'will make efforts to protect' creates ambiguity. Removing the mandatory execution of Business Associate Agreements directly violates HIPAA requirements for handling protected health information (PHI).
perturbation.contradicted_law: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)

perturbation.original_text: 5.3 Licenses and Certifications. Biocept and, to the extent applicable, Life Technologies shall have at all times during the Term, all necessary federal, state and local licenses, qualifications and certifications to operate a laboratory and perform their respective components of the Test(s), including, but not limited to, state laboratory licenses, CLIA certification, CAP (College of American Pathologists) certification, FDA registration, and any other licenses or certification required by state and/or federal law. All Assays performed by Biocept, and, to the extent applicable, Life Technologies, shall be in accordance with applicable state and federal testing requirements for clinical reference laboratories.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 Licenses and Certifications. Biocept and Life Technologies will attempt to maintain necessary licenses and certifications to operate a laboratory. Assays performed by Biocept and Life Technologies will generally align with state and federal testing guidelines.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall have at all times' to 'will attempt to maintain' and 'shall be in accordance with' to 'will generally align with', the contract weakens the commitment to maintain required licenses/certifications and follow testing requirements. This introduces a legal risk because clinical laboratories are required to be licensed and certified under CLIA and state laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) and relevant state laboratory licensing laws.
